Subject: Search Question

X-Yahoo-Profile: rog_21

I was thinking about the possibility of creating a
search engine type functionality using Neural Net and
GAs. I came up with a list of inputs e.g. page size,
uptime, response time.... and then the fitness
function would be based on the number of clicks users
make to go to a new page. I am a relative newbie and I
was going to base some of the design on the ai-junkie
and smartsweepers.
Where the sweeper in this case would be the particular
algorithm used. However how would I apply an algorith
that is evolved. Let me rephrase. for example in the
smart sweepers, for each sweeper we can determine the
proximity to a mine and therefore evolve a better
brain on the next iteration, but how do we know the
response time for a search algorithm when there are
possibly hundreds of pages with differeing response
times? I am wondering if this type of problem has been
solved where it is not a one to one relationship, but
more of a contains relationship.
Thanks,
Rog
